answers.answer: Hi there. This could be intention tremor seen in cerebellar diseases. Other types of tremors are psychogenic, essential, resting etc. Rule out diabetes, hypothyroidism, alcoholism, B12 deficiency etc.   A neurologist must examine you in detail to treatthese symptoms. take care.

question: I am experiencing fingers trembling while writing since last 10 years. My age is 49 years. My right thumb tendon was cut in an accident and operated about 10 years back. Since then I use to write with my index and middle fingers ( is not using thumb finger ) Kindly advice me
title: Figers trembling
